document_data.name: Fadahl al-Araj
document_data.mainbody: '''Fadahl al-Araj''', also called '''Fadahl the Crippled''' and previously '''Fadahl the Enlightened''', served as vizier for the [[House of Tayif]] tribe in the [[High Desert]] of [[west Zakhara]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40">
document_data.Activities: Fadahl's knowledge of the desert and hatred for those who harmed him served his [[Mouli al-Ajami|Sheikh]] well.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
document_data.History: Fadahl was once a [[sage]] in [[Hiyal]]. An incident with the [[Alurah bint Asrah|Sultana]] resulted in his legs getting crushed as his punishment. He left the city for [[Qudra]] where he begged for food on the streets until, as [[Zakharan pantheon|Fate]] would have it, he had a chance meeting with Mouli during his escape from the city.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
document_data.Possessions: Fadahl was almost always riding atop his treasured ''[[flying carpet]]'', which was a gift from Mouli for his services and friendship.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p40"/>
